Description: Mould-made pottery lamp, a solid lug on the right side, a short tapering flat-topped flaring nozzle, and a flat circular base. Raised ridge around the oil pouring hole. Blackening around the wick hole. Red slipped. Red-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Later 2nd to 1st century BC parallel from Alexandria (Mlynarczyk 1998, Figs 12a, 13de 11c, see also Mlynarczyk 1997, 20, Type A.a.2, Fig. 13). 2nd century BC parallel from Tell Atrib (Młynarczyk 2012, type TA 11.2). Mlynarczyk, J. 1997. Alexandrian and Alexandria-influenced mould-made lamps of the Hellenistic period. BAR International Series 677. Mlynarczyk, J. 1998. Terracotta mould-made lamps in Alexandria (Hellenistic to Late Roman period), in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 327-52. Młynarczyk, J. 2012. Tell Atrib 1985-1995. Vol. 3: Terracotta oil lamps. Varsovie: Éditions Neriton.
Bibliographic references: Leonard 2001 / Ancient Naukratis: Excavations at a Greek Emporion in Egypt, Part II: The excavations at Kom Hadid. (p. 179, no.21, pl. 3.19.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KD.028) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: pl. 3.19, p. 176. no.21 (catalogue number)
